intro: Annesorhiza caffra, commonly known as the African yellow daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow ray flowers and greenish-brown disc florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a short, sturdy stem with linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind. Annesorhiza caffra is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant appearance and drought tolerance.
